title: Ada & Archibald MacLeish Field Station Data
text: Weather conditions Smith College’s Ada & Archibald MacLeish Field Station recorded WhatelyMet weather station. weather collection site located end Poplar Hill Road Whately, Massachusetts, USA (Latitude 42 deg. 26 min. 56 sec. N Longitude 72 deg. 40 min. 50 sec. W). meteorological instruments WhatelyMet (except rain gauge) mounted top tower 25.3 m tall, well surrounding forest canopy. tower located local ridge elevation 250.75m sea level. second weather data collection site, known OrchardMet, located 250 m north first tower open field next apple orchard. Full canopy trees (~20 m tall) within 30 m station. station standard instrument configuration temperature, relative humidity, solar radiation, barometric pressure measured 1.5 2.0 m ground. Wind speed direction measured 10 m tall tower precipitation measured ground. Ground temperature measured 15 30 cm ground surface 2 m south tower. tower located 258.1 m sea level. Data collection OrchardMet began June 27th, 2014. documentation describes weather data collected WhatelyMet OrchardMet 2015. provides highlights year’s weather well general trends observed. hope find documentation interesting useful. data reported document available macleish package R.

However, daily temperature ranges less three degrees also occurred April 7th, February 9th, June 1st, June 28th.

title: Ada & Archibald MacLeish Field Station Data
text: Wind speed direction measured every second averaged logged every 10 minutes weather stations. OrchardMet measures wind midway forest canopy (10 m high) small woodland clearing WhatelyMet measures wind 25.3 m ground tree canopy. OrchardMet located woodland clearing winds buffeted trees forest canopy. wind comes west southwest, 67% time less 1 m/s. Wind speeds average 3 m/s time year.  WhatelyMet forest canopy recorded winds frequently northwest, north, south year. Average wind velocities higher, 46% measurements falling 1 2 m/s, maximum average velocities 6 m/s.
code: orchard_2015 |>   mutate(wind_dir_bin = factor(floor(wind_dir / 31))) |>   ggplot(aes(y = wind_speed, x = wind_dir_bin)) +   geom_boxplot() +   coord_radial() +   scale_x_discrete("Wind direction (degrees from North)") +   scale_y_continuous("Wind speed (meters per second)") whately_2015 |>     mutate(wind_dir_bin = factor(floor(wind_dir / 31))) |>   ggplot(aes(y = wind_speed, x = wind_dir_bin)) +   geom_boxplot() +   coord_radial() +   scale_x_discrete("Wind direction (degrees from North)") +   scale_y_continuous("Wind speed (meters per second)")

title: Ada & Archibald MacLeish Field Station Data
text: total 1306 mm precipitation recorded WhatelyMet 2015. Although precipitation relatively evenly distributed across year, precipitation totals highest June lowest May. Since data recorded every ten minutes, need group data daily order get mean rainfall amount per day. following plot show much rainfall per day macleish field station 2015, well cumulative amount rainfall course year.  February March greatest number precipitation events. Annual precipitation accumulated low, fairly steady rate June. June rainfall levels increased total accumulation increased sharply end calendar year. Starting June series large rainfall events (40-50 mm) occurred regularly summer. largest precipitation event 2015 occurred September 30th 113.8 mm (8.7% annual total) precipitation fell. 2015, 15, 25.4 mm (1”) precipitation events; 2, 50.8 mm (2”) precipitation events; 1, 76.2 mm (3”) precipitation event.
code: whately_2015 |>   summarize(total_rainfall = sum(rainfall)) ## # A tibble: 1 × 1 ##   total_rainfall ##            <dbl> ## 1          1306. monthly_w <- whately_2015 |>   mutate(the_month = month(when, label = TRUE, abbr = FALSE)) |>   group_by(the_month) |>   summarize(total_precip_w = sum(rainfall)) monthly_o <- orchard_2015 |>   mutate(the_month = month(when, label = TRUE, abbr = FALSE)) |>   group_by(the_month) |>   summarize(total_precip_o = sum(rainfall)) monthly_w |>   inner_join(monthly_o, by = "the_month") ## # A tibble: 12 × 3 ##    the_month total_precip_w total_precip_o ##    <ord>              <dbl>          <dbl> ##  1 January            111.           124.  ##  2 February            53.1           71.6 ##  3 March               51.8           49.3 ##  4 April               67.3           63.5 ##  5 May                 39.1           31.8 ##  6 June               228.           209.  ##  7 July               146.           125.  ##  8 August             137.           119.  ##  9 September          202.           181.  ## 10 October             79.0           72.9 ## 11 November            55.9           53.1 ## 12 December           136.           109. daily_precip <- whately_2015 |>   mutate(the_date = as.Date(when, tz = "EST")) |>   group_by(the_date) |>   summarize(N = n(), total_precip = sum(rainfall)) |>   mutate(     cum_precip = cumsum(total_precip),     cum_rescale = (cum_precip / max(cum_precip)) * max(total_precip)   ) ggplot(   data = daily_precip,   aes(x = the_date, y = total_precip) ) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   geom_line(aes(y = cum_rescale), color = "blue") +   ylab("Daily Precipitation (mm)") +   xlab(NULL)

title: Retrieve Data from MacLeish Field Station
text: Ada Archibald MacLeish Field Station 260-acre patchwork forest farmland located West Whately, MA provides opportunities faculty students pursue environmental research, outdoor education, low-impact recreation. MacLeish Field Station R package allows download process weather data using ETL framework MacLeish Field Station. also contains shapefiles contextualizing spatial information.

title: Retrieve Data from MacLeish Field Station
text: Weather readings logged every 10 minutes. Current historical (dating back 1/3/2012 whately 6/27/2014 orchard) meteorological readings available ETL framework. Please see documentation package information works.
code: macleish <- etl("macleish") macleish |>   etl_update() whately <- macleish |>   tbl("whately") whately |>   mutate(the_year = strftime('%Y', when)) |>   group_by(the_year) |>   summarize(N = n(), begin = min(when), end = max(when), avg_temp = mean(temperature))  orchard <- macleish |>   tbl("orchard") orchard |>   mutate(the_year = strftime('%Y', when)) |>   group_by(the_year) |>   summarize(N = n(), begin = min(when), end = max(when), avg_temp = mean(temperature)) daily <- whately |>   mutate(the_date = date(when)) |>   group_by(the_date) |>   summarize(N = n(), avgTemp = mean(temperature)) |>   collect()  library(ggplot2) ggplot(data = daily, aes(x = as.Date(the_date), y = avgTemp)) +   geom_point() + geom_smooth()

code: class(macleish_layers) ## [1] "list" names(macleish_layers) ##  [1] "landmarks"         "forests"           "streams"           ##  [4] "challenge_courses" "buildings"         "wetlands"          ##  [7] "boundary"          "research"          "soil"              ## [10] "trails"            "camp_sites"        "elevation" library(leaflet) leaflet() |>   addTiles() |>   addPolygons(     data = macleish_layers[["boundary"]],      weight = 1, fillOpacity = 0.1   ) |>   addPolygons(     data = macleish_layers[["buildings"]],      weight = 1, popup = ~ name   ) |>   addPolylines(     data = macleish_layers[["trails"]],      weight = 1, color = "brown",     popup = ~ name   ) |>   addPolylines(     data = macleish_layers[["streams"]],      weight = 2   ) |>   addMarkers(     data = filter(macleish_layers[["landmarks"]], grepl("Met", Label)),      popup = ~Label   )

title: Weather data from Macleish Field Stations — whately_2015
text: Macleish Field Station remote outpost owned Smith College used field research. two weather stations premises. One called WhatelyMet OrchardMet. WhatelyMet station located (42.448470, -72.680553) OrchardMet station (42.449653, -72.680315). WhatelyMet located end Poplar Hill Road Whately, Massachusetts, USA. meteorological instruments WhatelyMet (except rain gauge) mounted top tower 25.3 m tall, well surrounding forest canopy. tower located local ridge elevation 250.75m sea level. OrchardMet located 250 m north first tower open field next apple orchard. Full canopy trees (~20 m tall) within 30 m station. station standard instrument configuration temperature, relative humidity, solar radiation, barometric pressure measured 1.5 2.0 m ground. Wind speed direction measured 10 m tall tower precipitation measured ground. Ground temperature measured 15 30 cm ground surface 2 m south tower. tower located 258.1 m sea level. Data collection OrchardMet began June 27th, 2014. variables shown weather data collected WhatelyMet OrchardMet 2015. Solar radiation measured two different ways: see SlrW_Avgor PAR variables Photosynthetic Active Radiation. Note loose wire resulted erroneous temperature reading OrchardMet late November, 2015.
